PPP Minta Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi Jelaskan Korelasi Cadar dengan Radikalisme
01 Nov 2019, 12:16 by Muhammad Irfan
JAKARTA, (PR).- Wacana Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi yang hendak mengkaji pelarangan cadar dan celana cingkrang di lingkungan instansi pemerintah dipertanyakan PPP (Partai Persatuan Pembangunan).
Wakil Sekjen PPP Ahmad Baidowi menilai, Menteri Agama perlu menjelaskan serinci mungkin mengenai kaitan antara cara berpakaian dengan pemahaman yang dianut seseorang.
Melalui siaran persnya, Jumat 1 November 2019, legislator yang akrab disapa Awiek itu menilai kebijakan tersebut berpotensi melanggar HAM meski dari perspektif keamanan bisa saja dibenarkan.
Fachrul Razi juga perlu menyosialisasikan secara utuh apakah aturan itu akan diterapkan bagi PNS di instansi pemerintahan, lingkungan Kementerian Agama saja, atau bagi masyarakat umum.
“Menag harus menjelaskan kepada publik terkait korelasi cara berpakaian terhadap radikalisme, agar persoalan menjadi jernih," kata Awiek.
PPP, kata dia, tidak keberatan jika cadar dilarang bagi PNS di lingkungan Kementerian Agama saja. Sementara jika ingin diterapkan bagi PNS di seluruh instansi pemerintahan, Kementerian Agama tidak memiliki kewenangan kecuali ada kebijakan dari Kementerian Pendayagunaan Aparatur Negara-Reformasi Birokrasi.
"Mengingat tupoksi Kemenag hanya berwenang mengatur ASN di internal," kata dia.
Awiek juga menegaskan, jangan sampai pelarangan itu diartikan menjauhkan sebagian pihak dari semangat ke-Islaman.
“Jangan sampai larangan penggunaan cadar dipahami sebagai larangan penggunaan jilbab karena tingkat pemahaman masyarakat tidak merata," ucap dia.***

PPP Asks Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi Explain Correlation of Veils with Radicalism
Nov 01 2019, 12:16 by Muhammad Irfan
JAKARTA, (PR) .- The discourse of the Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi who wants to study the prohibition of veils and green pants in government agencies is questioned by the PPP (United Development Party).
Deputy Secretary General of PPP Ahmad Baidowi rate, the Minister of Religion needs to explain in as much detail as possible about the relationship between how to dress with the understanding adopted by someone.
Through its press release, Friday 1 November 2019, the legislator who is familiarly called Awiek considered that the policy had the potential to violate human rights even though from a security perspective it could be justified.
Fachrul Razi also needs to fully socialize whether the regulation will be applied to civil servants in government agencies, the Ministry of Religion alone, or to the general public.
"The Minister of Religion must explain to the public the correlation between how to dress and radicalism, so that the problem becomes clear," said Awiek.
PPP, he said, did not mind if the veil was banned for civil servants within the Ministry of Religion alone. Meanwhile, if it wants to be applied to civil servants in all government agencies, the Ministry of Religion does not have authority unless there is a policy from the Ministry of Administrative Reform and Bureaucracy Reform.
"Considering that the Ministry of Religion is only authorized to regulate ASN internally," he said.
Awiek also stressed, do not let the prohibition be interpreted as alienating some parties from the Islamic spirit.
"Don't let the veil ban be understood as a ban on the veil because the level of community understanding is uneven," he said. ***
